Ingredients.3: 10  dried red chile peppers, or more to taste

Ingredients.4: 2  pasilla chile peppers - stems, seeds, and veins removed

Ingredients.9: 0.25 cup crumbled queso fresco, or to taste

Directions.1: Combine 3 cups water, tomatoes, and chile peppers in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until softened, about 8 minutes.

Directions.2: Heat remaining 3 cups water in a separate saucepan.

Directions.3: Drain tomato-pepper mixture and transfer to a blender. Blend until sauce is smooth, adding about 1/2 cup hot water if needed. Season with salt.

Directions.4: Cut tortillas into medium chip-sized pieces using kitchen shears.

Directions.5: Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Fry tortilla chips in batches until firm and crispy, about 1 minute per batch. Drain on paper towels and let cool.

Directions.6: Spread about 1 teaspoon of the hot oil in a large pan. Carefully pour in tomato-pepper sauce. Add 2 1/2 cups hot water and bring to a simmer. Stir in tortilla chips and reduce heat to medium-low. Stir gently until chips are bright orange but still somewhat crunchy, about 1 minute.

Directions.7: Transfer to serving plates and garnish with onion and queso fresco.
